p: Methyl jasmonate [methyl 3oxo-2-(2-pentenyl) cyclopentaneacetate] ( Figure 3) is an oxylipin—a derivative of oxygenated fatty acid synthesized from linolenic acid in chloroplast membranes from jasmine. It abrogates parkinsonianlike symptoms possessing multiple protective activities against neurodegeneration. Methyl jasmonate inhibits oxidative stress, has anti-inflammatory activity and down regulates α-synuclein expression [ 68].
